summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case USA v. Maxwell, setting a schedule for pretrial disclosures and motions related to the S2 indictment. It outlines deadlines for expert witness disclosure, supplemental motions, and disclosure of alleged victims.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell, issuing orders that govern the pretrial proceedings.
David Boies is listed as receiving notice of the court order, indicating he is likely part of Maxwell's legal team or involved in related litigation.

events.title: Government expert witness disclosure deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to disclose expert witnesses, per agreement of the parties.

events.title: Defense supplemental motions deadline
events.description: Deadline for the defense to file supplemental pretrial motions pertaining to the new charges in the S2 indictment.

events.title: Disclosure of alleged victims deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to disclose the identities of the alleged victims referenced in the S2 indictment, per agreement of the parties.

events.title: Government's response to defense motions deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to file responses to the defense's supplemental motions.

events.title: Defense replies deadline
events.description: Deadline for the defense to file replies to the government's responses.

keyFacts: The court order establishes a pretrial schedule for the criminal case USA v. Maxwell, specifically addressing procedures related to the S2 indictment.
A key deadline is set for May 17, 2021, for the government to disclose the alleged victims referenced in the S2 indictment.
The order indicates the case is proceeding with supplemental motions focused on new charges brought in a superseding indictment (S2).
The document lists numerous attorneys receiving notice, highlighting the extensive legal team involved in the case.
